page.title: 20ELDWICK AND GILSTEAD JOIN ?
page.content: Until about thirty years ago this area completely separated the two villages of{ELDWICK and GILSTEAD}.Today it now contains the largest{housing estates in the whole neighbourhood.The{Heaton} {Estate}developed all the open land to the West of Warren Lane,right up to the edge of the former Gilstead Moor Quarries.It included a{general store. Part of the Moor is covered in water by the{Gilstead Filter Beds}which are on the underground aquaduct from the reservoirs in Nidderdale to Bradford. On the East side a new{Middle School takes local children from 9 to 13 yrs A few fields were left on that side until about 200 houses were built in 1979. Old people in the area said no more could be built because there used to be delphstone mines under the land. {In June 1985 builders planned to add {129 houses after a Public Enquiry.
